intro: Crocus hadriaticus var. saundersianus, commonly known as the Adriatic crocus, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows and rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
